experience.title: Recor Medical
highlights: Developed a semantic segmentation model for automated classification of vasculature in X-ray images, achieving 2x improvement in both mask IoU and Boundary IoU to support medical device R&D workflows.

Engineered a complete ML pipeline using X-ray simulation to generate synthetic training data, implemented Pix2Pix generative adversarial networks for data augmentation, and trained semantic segmentation models for precise vascular structure identification.

experience.title: KSDT Radio
highlights: Develop, manage, and scale website infrastructure supporting 500+ active users across UC San Diego's radio broadcasting platform.
Lead technical operations including live audio streaming systems, user authentication, and content management while coordinating development team initiatives.

experience.title: UCSD Department of Mathematics
highlights: Led discussion sections for over 500+ students, maintaining office hours, and proctoring exams.

Courses: Calculus I (MATH 10A), Calculus III (MATH 10C), Calculus for Science and Engineering (MATH 20A), Calculus and Analytic Geometry for Science and Engineering (MATH 20C), Vector Calculus (MATH 20E)

experience.title: OrganRegistry.org
highlights: Engineered a custom ASCII-based rendering system in React for OrganRegistry.org for music playback and distribution.

Streamlined text and image-to-ASCII conversion with lossless compression, improving rendering efficiency by more than 10% using a Dockerized Flask backend to integrate Spotify's API and Amazon S3 for seamless data storage, retrieval, and machine learning model deployment.
Tools Used: React, Python, Flask, Docker, Spotify API, Amazon S3, NoSQL, Machine Learning, Three.js, WebGL

experience.title: UCSD Kaibigang Pilipino
highlights: Development of UCSD Kaibigang Pilipino's website, transforming Figma prototypes into dynamic, user-friendly interfaces for 2000+ users through iterative Agile sprints

Optimized content delivery by enhancing API efficiency with Google Sheets integration, improving website performance, and scalability, while spearheading the implementation of a secure Supabase-based user authentication system.
Tools Used: Javascript, React, SASS, Next.js, Figma, Google Sheets API, Supabase

experience.title: Eta Kappa Nu (HKN) at UCSD
highlights: Designed and delivered computer science curricula to socioeconomically disadvantaged classrooms in San Diego, teaching over 200+ students across multiple elementary and high schools.
Taught core computer science principles using tools like p5.js and Scratch, fostering creativity and computational thinking in students of varying skill levels.

projects.title: BetterWeb
highlights: Chrome extension that uses browser agents to persistently transform any website's CSS using natural language, enabling personalized styling and WCAG-compliant accessibility improvements across all web pages.

Implemented browser automation agents to scan websites for WCAG compliance issues across 5 disability categories, integrating Claude API for natural language CSS generation with persistent transformations stored in Convex database.

projects.title: SFGovTV++
highlights: A video digest platform that provides concise, searchable summaries of San Francisco's Board of Supervisors meeting footage. Civic transparency with AI-powered session insights and key takeaways.

Built a multi-model RAG system processing 5TB of videos and 700MB of transcripts with semantic chunking, pgVector embeddings, and parallel orchestration of GPT-4o, Gemini 2.0, and Perplexity for citizen question answering through cosine similarity search.

projects.title: CiteTrace
highlights: A cross-platform research visualization tool that transforms collections of academic works into interactive knowledge graphs, enabling users to explore connections between hundreds of pages of research

Developed Flask API with Gemini-powered RAG pipeline using Chroma vector database and HuggingFace embeddings for semantic search, enabling real-time conversational queries across research papers with automatic source attribution.

projects.title: Myoelectric Prosthetic Arm
highlights: Contributed to Triton Neurotech's Prosthetic Arm project, using PyTorch, and OpenBCI to preprocess and model EMG data. Developed and trained a feedforward neural network using PyTorch for multiclass classification on a dataset with 7 target classes. Optimized model performance through a comprehensive grid search.

projects.title: Recurrent Neural Networks for Time Series Forecasting of Fractional Brownian Motion
highlights: Developed an RNN model with LSTM units for time series forecasting of fractional Brownian motion (FBM) to study long-range dependence, achieving CRPS validation loss of 1.69 on synthetic data and 5.46 on real FBM data.

Implemented the Neural Quantile Function RNN (NQF-RNN) for probabilistic forecasting using quantile regression, generating a full predictive distribution with CRPS test loss of 5.25. Optimized models using learning rate scheduling techniques to improve forecast accuracy and convergence.

projects.title: PillSnap
highlights: A full-stack application that uses computer vision to identify pills, provide drug interaction warnings, and store medication data securely.
Integrated and fine-tuned the Gemini API using Vertex AI to focus on feature extraction, utilized Drugs.com for up-to-date FDA drug information, and implemented Auth0 for secure user authentication.

projects.title: Bouncer
highlights: A database manager that provides comprehensive risk assessments using publicly available information. Business access control with AI-powered consumer risk insights.

Uses facial recognition AI, Gemini 2.0, and Claude Sonnet 4 to search the internet for someone's face/name, scrape discovered pages (including Maryland court records with anti-bot bypass), then generate an AI-powered trustworthiness score from 0-1 based on criminal, financial, and social media risk factors.

projects.title: MATES
highlights: A platform that helps SDSU students discover and personalize campus event recommendations while connecting them with like-minded peers.

Uses user‐profile surveys with a Gemini‐powered, algorithmic recommendation engine to match students with personalized SDSU events and fellow attendees. Won Most Technical Project award at the 2025 Innovate 4 SDSU Hackathon.

projects.title: Supervised Sentiment Classification Model for Dialogue Systems in Fantasy RPGs
highlights: Developed a supervised sentiment analysis model tailored for fantasy role-playing dialogue systems. Fine-tuned XGBoost classifiers across ten emotional categories using exhaustive Grid Search, achieving precision, recall, and f1-scores of up to 95%, ensuring highly accurate emotional classification.
Tools Used: XGBoost, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, Numpy

projects.title: Deep Learning with Gary Cottrell (CSE 151B)
highlights: Implemented backpropagation, stochastic gradient descent, momentum, and L2/L1 regularization from scratch using Numpy, achieving 88.18% accuracy on the FashionMNIST dataset.

Developed a fully convolutional network for semantic segmentation on the PASCAL VOC-2012 dataset, improving mean IoU to 0.074 and pixel accuracy to 0.881 using techniques like transfer learning and data augmentation.

Implemented and compared vanilla RNN and LSTM models for character-level text generation on the TinyShakespeare dataset, evaluating the impact of teacher forcing, sequence length, and hidden layer size, with LSTM outperforming RNN in all experiments.
Investigated various fine-tuning methods for pretrained BERT, including LoRA, warm-up steps, SWA, and contrastive learning, achieving test accuracy of 0.92 on the Amazon Massive Scenario dataset.
